utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, I got us that room at the Woodford Inn this weekend.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That place in Vermont? You can take a hint!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait, you can't go away this weekend! It's Emma's birthday!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We're having a party.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, can't you just have the party when we get back?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, that day... that won't be her real birthday!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Gee if only she were one and had no idea what the hell a birthday was!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: C'mon you guys, this is really important to us.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I'm sorry, but Chandler and I could really use a weekend away. You know, to reconnect... emotionally.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There's this thing I really want us to do. I read about it in Maxim...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, can't you just go to Vermont the next day?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, we want everyone to be there. As much as I hate to delay your doing weird sex stuff to my little sister.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And I mean, you know, you guys... This is a big deal. I mean, how can we have her first birthday party without her aunt and her uncle!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, we'll stay. We can just drive up after the party.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fine, but if we end up not doing this Maxim thing because of this party...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Believe me, that is not why we won't be doing that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know Pheebs, when I was little, on my birthday, my daddy would hide a present in every room of the house, and then he would draw a treasure map to help me find 'em all.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oooh, I love family traditions like that. When uhm... when Ursula and I were kids, on our birthday, our stepdad would sell his blood to buy us food!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, I brought the camera for Emma's video.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, good, good! We had this idea to make a birthday video for Emma and we'll give it to her when she is 18.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, COOL!! Wow, it's like a time capsule!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, just think... she's gonna be watching that video on a TV that hasn't even been invented yet! With friends who right now are just like babies! And they'll be living in a floating city that the humans built to escape the ant people!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's the hope! So, is Emma awake yet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, it's still nap time. But she'll be up soon.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, and where is Joey?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I said it's still nap time.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, there is uncle Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, say something to Emma on her 18th birthday!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, NO!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, what!? it's for her hot friends!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: When they see this you'll be 52!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And starting to think about settling down!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Joey, will you please set this up for people to put Emma's presents on?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'd love to! Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We were supposed to bring presents?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! I wrote Emma a song.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah! How was I supposed to know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey, it's a birthday party.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but for a one-year-old. What's the point... the other day she laughed for like an hour at a cup. Just a cup with a picture of Elmo on it dressed as a farmer. And he's standing next to this cow and the cow says "El-moo"! Yeah... that's a funny cup!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey hey! Where's the birthday girl?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, she's still napping

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, sure, she was probably up all night, excited about the party she knows is happening.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, I know that you guys really want to get to Vermont and this isn't a really big deal to you, but it really is to us, ok? Emma will never have a first birthday again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right... you're right. We're sorry. Now let's wake up Emma and get the fun time started!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No really, she didn't sleep well last night, so we can't wake her up.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you freaking kidding me, Green?

utterance.speaker: Jack and Judy
utterance.content: HI!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So glad you came!

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I can't believe Emma is already one!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: I remember your first birthday! Ross was jealous of all the attention we were giving you. He pulled on his testicles so hard! We had to take him to the emergency room!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There's something you didn't know about your dad!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Mr. and Mrs. Geller! Let me help you with that.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh man, this is great, uh? The three of us together again! You know what would be fun? If we gave this present to Emma from all of us!

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Which one are you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't believe Emma is still asleep!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know, what are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I've got a plan. I've got a plan. I'm going to ram this platter really hard into your ribs. You're gonna scream out and that'll wake her up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm not going to Vermont with this Monica!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, you know what? I was thinking... since you wrote a song, maybe I could do something for Emma using my talents!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So you’re gonna... hit on her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no! My talents as an actor!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know, I could like maybe... I could do a dramatic reading of one of her books!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or you could stick a fork in an apple!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I think Emma might like it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Emma might like what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Um, my present!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What did you get her?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Actually we prepared performances.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Separate performances.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But equally real!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, this sounds like fun! Well, you know what? Actually? People are getting a little antsy waiting Emma to wake up from her nap, so would you mind performing them once now?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: O K.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, let’s get this party started, huh? Joey and Phoebe are gonna perform a little something for us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, great!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you gonna be embarrassed going up there having nothing prepared?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I do it every week with three cameras pointed at me and a whole crew waiting!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, Joey, what are you gonna do for us?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I will be doing a dramatic reading of one of Emma’s books.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, ok, which one?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, why, it’s a... one of her favorites, uh, “Riding the Storm Out. Coping with post-partum depression” eesh! “Love you forever”. Love you forever. By Robert Munsch. Published by Firefly books. Printed in Mexico. A mother held her new baby and very slowly rocked him back and forth, back and forth, back and forth, and while she held him she sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”. . And while he rocked her, he sang “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always, as long as I'm living, my baby you’ll be”.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! That was amazing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you so much for that gift!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Amazing... amazing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Phoebe, I’m sorry! Phoebe has prepared something as well.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s right, I've prepared a song for Emma. From my heart to hers. For there’s no greater gift, than the gift of music. Emma! Your name poses a dilemma. 'Cause not much else rhymes with Emma! Maybe the actor Richard Crenna, he played the commanding officer in Rambo. Happy birthday Emma!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Is that it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, of course not! I also, you know, prepared a reading . “Sex and the single mother. Finding your G-spot.

utterance.speaker: Everybody
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Hello Emma. Happy eighteenth birthday.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Right now that seems so far away, seventeen years.

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Yes, you’ll be all grown up by then. We’ll be... Well your grandfather and I might not be here.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: That’s true! This message could becoming to you from beyond the grave, Emma!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: After all, my parents died very young.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: And my cholesterol’s off the charts!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Remember, Emma, heart disease kills women too!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, um, don’t forget to get a shot of Emma’s cake. It’s in a box in the fridge.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you're gonna love this cake. I got it from a bakery in New Jersey, Corino’s.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, that place has the creamiest frosting! I use to hitchhike there when I was a kid.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, anyway, they make these great novelty cakes, in all different shapes, and if you give them a photo, they’ll copy it in icing!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, did you do a picture of Emma?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! On a cake shaped like a bunny.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, Rach? Does this bakery by any chance also bake erotic cakes? Say for bachelorette parties?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, what are you talking about? oh! Oh my God! They put my baby’s face on a penis!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why you guys this isn't funny, all right? If I wanted this cake to be a disaster I would have baked it myself!

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I know what you're thinking Judy, the resemblance is uncanny!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am this close to tugging on my testicles again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ask them if it would be faster if we cut the baby’s face off the penis, so we can put it on the bunny. . That is a weird sentence!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Believe you me! I am going to bring this cake back, I don't even want it in my home... Joey, don't touch it!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm so confused!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, yes. I still want my daughters picture, but on a bunny cake. Yellow cake, chocolate frosting with nuts!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To be fair this one does have nuts.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Mon, that was really nice of you to loan Rachel your car so she could go and get the cake.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. So nice of her to pull my hair, 'till I dropped the key!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you know what? While we're waiting, you guys could tape your message to Emma for her 18th birthday, huh? Ok!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi Emma! It's the year 2020. Are you still enjoying your nap?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're Aunt Monica and uncle Chandler, by the way. You may not recognize us, because we haven't spoken to your parents in seventeen years!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We used to be married, but then we missed a weekend away together and things kind of unraveled. Because of you! Happy Birthday.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, Rachel promised it would be over by now. We seriously have to go, if we want to get to Vermont. I called them and the last train leaves in a half hour.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And you know, I have a massage client soon.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You guys, just please.. a little bit longer. I promise, Rachel will be back with the cake any minute. Monica, remember.. the frosting? huh?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, 5 more minutes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello? Oh no! What happened? Ok ok, where are you? . Ok, I'll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Was that Emma? Is she up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, Rachel got pulled over for speeding. She forgot her licence so now I have to bring it to her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if you're leaving, I'm definitely gonna go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Wait! If anybody gets to go.. it's us We've been complaining the longest!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, wait ! You guys, no, no, you can't leave! Rachel already feels bad that the cake's messed up. How do you think she's gonna feel when she comes back here and all you guys are gone?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't know! You'll tell us on Monday!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey! You're in charge, ok? You make sure nobody leaves!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Got it! Hey hey hey! Where do you think you're going?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To the bathroom!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright, well the rest of you get comfortable, ok, because we're gonna be here for a li... Wait a minute, there is a window in there!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! He's not getting away that easy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing? Get the hell out of here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, that one did not have Emma's face on it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it did not.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Well, we better get going, it's late. Jack's not allowed to drive at night anymore. He has trouble staying in his lane.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Last winter I went up on a church lawn and drove right through a manger scene. The papers thought it was a hate crime.

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Anyway, it was lovely seeing you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Bye... Bye dear.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nighty-night!

utterance.speaker: Judy
utterance.content: Nighty-night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bye, bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey? How could you just let them leave?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey! I'm not gonna mess with Jack, he's a great man, he fought for our country.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, he didn't! He pretended to be a Quaker to get out of Korea.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Well that's it! He's the last one to go. I'm locking you guys in.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do know, I can just turn them the other way around, right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! I forgot you used to live here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Joey! It's Estelle!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: So, how did your audition go today?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What audition?

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: The one I told you about last week?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? You never said anything about an audition!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Let me start over. I just got a call about an audition. I think you can still make it. It's down at the Astor Theatre and you need to have a monologue prepared.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A monologue? I don't have.. I got it. Aah! so... I'm gonna take off!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wh.. what? No wait, you don't get to leave! I've got a massage client waiting outside my door any minute!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, and we've paid for a room, that we're supposed to be in right now!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, oh, ok now... Only one of us has to stay with Emma. Ok, and as the person who realized that, I get to go!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! no! Let's figure out a fair way to decide who's staying.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! I got it! Ok, everyone pick a number from one to ten. Alright? Whoever gets the highest number gets to go first.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, ten.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, Monica picks ten, I call nine! Anyone else?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, lets just draw straws.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Or.. we could flip a coin, and then multiply the..

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm begging you stop.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, how about this: We got wind up toys for Emma for her birthday. We can make them race, and whoever comes in last, stays!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!! Let's do that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That sounds more fun than the thing we were going to do in Vermont!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Everybody get your toys!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok! I want the dolphin!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thats a bear.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm too excited!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, you get the bear, uhm, Joey, you get the robot, and Chandler and I get the dog. Ok, and the race is going to go from here to here. Now the one who comes in last, stays!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ok, ladies and gentlemen, wind your toys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, on your mark... Get set... GO!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on robot!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you barking at?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wha... How the hell is that gonna help?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I bought you. How did I forget that that's all you do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Way to go robot!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good job Alan!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, good race you guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, see you later!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No, no... wait! We didn't lose. The rules clearly stated that the last one to cross the finish line was the loser. Well, our dog never crossed the finish line, so technically...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, there isn't time to go to the bakery. We're just gonna come home... Everybody left? Alright, well just tell Emma we're gonna be there as soon as we can. Bye...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: RACHEL!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: OOH! God! Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can't believe they gave you a ticket. You're such a good driver.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Emma's awake.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't believe this. This is her first birthday. She's awake. We're not even there. Everybody left. We still have this stupid obscene cake.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, maybe I can fix that, you know. Try to turn it into something else.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, why do you even bother? I already ruined her first birthday... And do you know how important these early experiences are Ross? Very! According to the back cover of that book that you gave me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, she's not going to remember this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I guess... Oh, I just had such an idea of what this day would be like, you know? Emma laughing and everybody gathered around her cake singing "Happy Birthday". Then we would all go into... HEY GET OUT OF THE ROAD YOU STUPID STUDENT DRIVER!!! They have to learn!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's not bad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Look what... you made it into a bunny. How did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I just made these two things uhm... cheeks. And then I split this to make ears.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I'm very impressed.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Some can sing, some can dance. I apparently can turn phallic cakes into woodland creatures.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now another way to organise your stuffed animals, is by size.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry, is this a game for Emma or for Monica?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Game?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Emma, you even know it's your birthday today? You're one! One-year-old, that's little.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh! That's my girl!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's how old you are.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did I teach her that? Did I just... impart wisdom?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ooh, I want one...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Me too...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There's no-one around. Why don't we just take this one?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...and head to Canada!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I was kidding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I wasn't. Let's get going!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, are Ross and Rachel back?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, not yet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh good, I didn't miss the party.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What about your massage client?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just felt so bad, missing this. So I just slipped him a little something, you know. As long as I'm back in five or six hours, it will be alright.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, if Ross and Rachel ask, I've been here the whole time. THE WHOLE TIME!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I've been here the whole time!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, we just saw you come in. You ran past us on the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't care that you left. I'm just glad that you're here. Thanks you guys!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, guys! Come on! You gotta see what Emma just did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Emma, how old are you? How old are you today?

utterance.speaker: Emma
utterance.content: Wo-ish.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Emma, that's right! You're that many!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God! Our daughter's a genius! Rach, this means...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: NO, no science camp!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Damnit! I'll put a candle on the cake.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!... Oh and Emma, look at your stuffed animals lined up so neatly!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, here we go! Emma's first birthday cake... Well hey... well, blow out the candle. Come on Emma.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let's do it, come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What's wrong? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, nothing! These are happy tears! This is just what I wanted.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, you made it into a bunny.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What is wrong with me. It looked more delicious when it was a penis.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, you ready?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A-a-and... record.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Hi Emma. Well, your first birthday is over, and it was really...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Go, go, go Alan! Run you hairy bastard!
